frameDefinitions: Geography as defined by its use.
An Entity that is previously not visible to a Perceiver becomes visible.
In the Appeal stage of the criminal process the Convict or his or her Representative applies to a higher Court to reverse the Decision of the lower court on certain Grounds. '

The words in this frame have to do with a Speaker asking an Addressee a question which calls for a reply (as opposed to making a request which calls for an action on the part of the Addressee).  '' 'We asked Ruby what kind of food they ate.'
A Complainer communicates their negative emotional reaction to some state of affairs in a Complaint to an Addressee.

The judge or other court officer (the Authority) informs the Accused of the Charges against him/her, i.e. the alleged actions and the relevant laws. '' 'The board has been accused by the federal court of making decisions based on narrow agendas and meddling where it shouldn't.'
frameExamples: You must land in the next <t><fex name='Locale'>airfield</fex></t>, as this one is currently having difficulties.
The armada <t>appeared</t> on the horizon at sunset.
The defense plans to <t>appeal</t> the court's decision on the grounds that the judge violated Code 81.b .
We <t>asked</t> Ruby what kind of food they ate.
The top US commander in Iraq <t>complained</t> to the Pentagon last winter that his supply situation was so poor that it threatened Army troops' ability to fight.
The board has been <t>accused</t> by the federal court of making decisions based on narrow agendas and meddling where it shouldn't.
listRoleDefinitions: A stable bounded area.  It is typically the designation of the nouns of Locale-derived frames.
The activity that is carried out in the <fen>Locale</fen>.
The thing that the <fen>Perceiver</fen> is able to see or recognize.
A temporal description of the event of the <fen>Entity</fen> becoming visible.
The physical location in which the <fen>Entity</fen> becomes visible.
The <fen>Convict</fen> is the individual convicted of the crime who may make an appeal on her or his behalf.
The <fen>Representative</fen> applies to a higher court on behalf of the <fen>Convict</fen>.
The <fen>Decision</fen> is the ruling handed down by the first court.
The <fen>Time</fen> at which a <fen>Convict</fen> or <fen>Representative</fen> appeals.
The person asking a question generally occurs as the External Argument of verb and noun targets:

The Addressee is most frequently the NP Object of a target verb.  However, with the verb <ment>inquire</ment>, Addressee can only occur as an <ment>of</ment>-PP and with a noun target, Addressee occurs in a PP Complement or as a possessive :
The Message, or content of the question, usually takes the form of a direct quote or an embedded question with a verb target:
Topic occurs very frequently in this frame with both noun and verb targets. It generally occurs as a PP Complement:
The time at which the questioning occurs.
The <fen>Complainer</fen> is the sentient entity that produces the <fen>Complaint</fen> (whether spoken or written).
The lamentable situation that the <fen>Complainer</fen> is communicating to the <fen>Addressee</fen>.
The <fen>Topic</fen> is the subject matter to which the <fen>Complaint</fen> pertains.
<fen>Medium</fen> is the physical entity or channel used by the <fen>Complainer</fen> to transmit the <fen>Complaint</fen>.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the complaint is made.
This role specifies the location where the complaining takes place.
The judge or other authority of the court in which the accused person is arraigned.
The person being charged with an offense against the law.
The crime with which the Accused is charged
When the event occurs.
Where the event takes place.
listRoleExamples: There used to be a carnival every summer in that <fex><t>city</t></fex>.
The Campus <fex>Microscopy and Imaging</fex> Facility (CMIF) serves a wide range of faculty staff and students of The Ohio State University .
<fex>Pat</fex> quizzed me about where I had been.
Pat questioned <fex>me</fex> about where I had been.

<fex>Peter</fex> has moaned about it on another thread but it sure must be nice for him to wallow
again.
One observer groused <fex>that Skagway was 'little better than hell on earth.'</fex>
Ferdinand attended the reception at the city hall and complained vociferously <fex>about his reception at the city</fex>.
I don't mean to discount any of what he has bitched about <fex>in his article</fex>, because most of his points are actually valid.
Now <fex>yesterday</fex> I pissed and moaned about Rolling Stone magazines choice for the number 1 song of all time.
Guest Relations actually refunded the full eighty-five dollar price of the event to many event attendees who complained <fex>at City Hall</fex>.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: the Australian Competition and Consumer Commission
